start.text: You are a Dog. You got a piece of meat and were carrying it home in your mouth. You want to eat it in peace. You have to cross a plank lying across a running brook. What would you do while crossing?

shadow_reflected.text: You saw something reflected in the water beneath. There it is, another dog with another piece of meat. What would you do to that thing?

choices.text: You did nothing. You were calm and not surprised at all.

snap_shadow.text: You also wanted the other dog’s meat. But while you snapped, you own meat fell out of your mouth. The meat dropped into the water and was never seen more. What is the moral of the story?

choices.text: Beware lest you lose the substance by grasping at the shadow.
Do not open your mouth when you chew

saw_nothing.text: You made the right choice. It’s hard enough, only to protect what’s in your mouth. You saw nothing on the way, thus you had no reason to be surprised at anything. You finished your tasty meat after you went home.

nothing_happens.text: You made the right choice. It’s hard enough, only to protect what’s in your mouth. At first, you saw something, but you soon realized that was just a shadow. You had no reason to be surprised at a shadow. You finished your tasty meat after you went home.

great_job.text: You lost your meat, but there will always be another in the future. You learned now, so maybe next time you won’t lose it. You will be calm and unbothered, and that will let you keep your meat in the future

read_more.text: You lost your meat, and you are still on the way to your lesson. Sometimes, it is not only your action that matters. It is your mindset that matters, after all. Please think again. Why would you, the dog, open the mouth?
